name: Premier Inn London Tower Bridge

reviews.text: Have previously stayed at the County Hall Premier Inn on a work trip and found it fine
reviews.title: The only thing Lenny Henry's been in that I actually like

reviews.text: This trip was 2 nights with my wife for sightseeing so wanted to keep accommodation costs down. Decided on Tower Bridge as it was cheaper than some alternatives and had parking on site
reviews.title: Thoroughly recommended

reviews.text: Check-in was quick and easy and plenty of room to park (£15 per day)
reviews.title: Made the weekend

reviews.text: Room was spotless and comfortable as advertised. Bathroom was also very clean, the usual area that things are a let down in my experience
reviews.title: Great hotel for short sightseeing or theatre break

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room was on 5th floor and very quiet
reviews.title: New Years Stay in London

reviews.text: Arrived solo and colleagues joined later. Absolutely appalling hotel - but trying to find some positives about my experience....
reviews.title: AVOID, AVOID, AVOID!!!!
Buyer beware
reviews.text: CON: Staff are ignorant and outright rude, rarely deviating from a script - PRO: They don't speak to you much - at least not in intelligible English.
CON: The food in the restaurant is atrocious, and the menu is limited - PRO: I lost weight as most things on the menu weren't available anyway!
reviews.title: Dirty bathroom
Great location! Perfect for London Tower Bridge.
reviews.text: CON: The rooms are dank and dated - PRO: Bad lighting means you don't see the bags under your eyes from the rough night.
CON: Furniture had some 'interesting' odours - PRO: Removed temptation to eat in the restaurant.
reviews.title: Great base - Great Staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed in this hotel for two nights, staff freindly , rooms good value and clean, breakfast buffet very good. Proximity to tube is good walking time is 10-12 mins. From London bridge tube station take tooley road exit Turn right on to tooley road , follow to end of road T Junction. You will see wetherspoons pub on Corner. Turn right on to Tower Hill Road ,Hotel about 800mtrs down on Right hand side
reviews.title: Good hotel and location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Alright, So i spent only two nights at the hotel and I was hardly there during the day, BUT it was better then i expected. The room was well clean and everything worked! Though the 'soap dispenser' in the bathroom does need to be checked from time to time, had enough for just one shower! the Tube is a bit of a walk but there is a bus stop right outside and to the right. Walk further and you'll reach a restaurant called Del'Aziz, lovely English brekkie there! Overall, I'd gladly stay there again next time in the City.
reviews.title: Lovely!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is only a short walk from London's famous Tower Bridge. It is also easy to get to all of the other attractions in London -- whether you are keen to walk or catch the tube from the nearby station.
reviews.title: Just down the road from famous London Bridge

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms were clean and spacious. The service when we were there, while sufficient, was pretty average. The staff were not very welcoming. We had a couple of small things wrong in the room (ie bathroom sink plug was permanently jammed close), and despite a couple of calls to housekeeping the problems were not attended to which was frustrating. The exception was the hotel restaurant which has great food at reasonable prices and good staff. No free wi-fi. But there is a pub nearby with nice cheap food and free wi-fi.
reviews.title: Lenny Henry doesn't lie...

reviews.text: The area seemed nice and safe, we always felt safe walking around at night. London is a great city to explore, and this hotel is a cheap and comfortable place to base yourself.
reviews.title: Great hotel - shame about the breakfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Premier Inn at Tower Bridge is no different to any other Premier Inn. And that's a good thing. The rooms are spacious, decked out in the company's trademark purple, and kitted with a good television (several digital channels, as well as the terrestrial five), tea/coffee tray, table and chair combo, and a lovely big bed. The bathroom is comfortable and of a decent size. There is a shower over the bath, which is always more appealing than just a shower cubical.
reviews.title: Incredible value!

reviews.text: We didn't eat in the hotel restaurant at dinner, but did pay an additional £7.50 each for a "Premier Breakfast". It seemed pricey at the time of booking (given that the room cost under £100!), but turned out to be well worth the money! The choice at breakfast was great: branded cereals, granola and fruits, continental options, and of course, the full English. It's self-serve and all-you-can-eat. I suggest you eat a lot.
reviews.title: Good value stay

reviews.text: The main appeal of this particular Premier Inn branch is its location. The hotel is just a few minutes' walk from the nearest tube station, making it very easily accessible for most of the touristy areas of London. When we visited there was actually a partial closure on a few lines, but we still didn't have much trouble getting to the hotel, back into Covent Garden, and then back to the hotel at around 10pm. The 24 hour reception desk at the Premier Inn is a real benefit.
reviews.title: Excellent Base for London Sightseeing

reviews.text: This is an excellent hotel, in a prime location, and the price is inarguably very, very good.
reviews.title: Very impressed with hotel and staff, would certainly revisit.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We frequently stay with Premier Inn as they represent good value with friendly staff - but this is always in the north (usually Carlisle). I expected standards to be lower in the capital - but pleased to note I was wrong! Very slick reception, but staff very helpful & greeted us every time we encountered them.
reviews.title: Excellent

aka: Premier Inn London Tower Bridge Hotel London
